alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued April 08 at 1:41PM EDT until April 11 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...The combination of strong and gusty onshore winds along with building seas on Sunday will produce increasingly hazardous conditions along the Volusia County coast. Onshore winds will become gusty during the afternoon into the overnight with sustained winds of 20 to 30 mph, and gusts up to 40 mph. Expect a runup of surf during several high tides, beginning with the 9 to 11 PM high tide Sunday evening, through the high tide after midnight on Tuesday morning. Large breakers, deadly rip currents and moderate beach erosion will all be possible Sunday night through Monday night. * WHERE...Coastal Volusia County. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Some roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Shoreline erosion will be likely.
info.instruction: Conditions favorable for coastal flooding are expected to develop. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements or warnings and take necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
